definition: to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
account/bill/debt/CL:本[ben3],筆|笔[bi3]

sentences.english: It is no use raking over the past, let us look ahead to the future.
sentences.chinese: 翻老账没用，让我们向前看眼望未来吧。

sentences.english: Let bygones be bygones, Don't dig up the past.
sentences.chinese: 让过去的过去吧，不要翻老账。

definition: to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to discuss sth on its own merits/to judge the matter as it stands
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
lit. stale grain, overcooked sesame (idiom); fig. the same boring old gossip
pinyin: chen2 gu3 zi5 lan4 zhi1 ma5

definition: lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge
lit. settling accounts after the autumn harvest (idiom); to wait until the time is ripe to settle accounts/to bide time for revenge
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to insult/to direct bad language at sb/to slag off
to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)
to raise the same old topic again/to hark back
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to pick a quarrel/to find fault/nitpicking
to grab sb by the pigtail/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings
to raise the same topic
